definition: to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover

sentences.english: Not obtrusive, go up pertly courtship, you can refuse for certain.
sentences.chinese: 不要莽撞，冒冒失失上去求爱，你肯定会遭拒绝。

sentences.english: He bulled into a job that he had never done before.
sentences.chinese: 他冒冒失失地参加了一项他从未做过的工作。

sentences.english: It's improper to drop in on him so casually.
sentences.chinese: 这样冒冒失失去找他可不好。

sentences.english: Next time you call, knock at the door. Don't plunge head first into another person's room.
sentences.chinese: 你下次来访要先敲门，别冒冒失失地撞进别人的房间。

sentences.english: He rashly took the business in hand, and regretted shortly afterwards.
sentences.chinese: 他冒冒失失地把这件事揽过去不久就后悔了。

definition: lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
not to know the immensity of heaven and earth/an exaggerated opinion of one's own abilities
pinyin: bu4 zhi1 tian1 gao1 di4 hou4

definition: not knowing when to come or leave (idiom); with no sense of propriety
variant of 魯莽|鲁莽[lu3 mang3]
variant of 糊裡糊塗|糊里糊涂[hu2 li5 hu2 tu2]
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
